item.description: "Juegos olimpicos" (Olympic Games) is a game for the whole family, consisting of different Olympic events (marathon, long and high jump, hammer throw, sprint race...) wich take place in different boardgames, each with it's own rules and mechanics. After each event, the winners receive individual medals (gold, silver and bronze) and at the end of the Olympics, after having competed in all events (having played in all the boardgames), the one who has amassed the largest number of medals, taking into account its value (a gold medal is worth more than two bronze), is declared the winner.

Empires and Generals is a Print and Play Collectible Card Game with free content available from EmpiresandGenerals.com.

You play as a famous Empire from real history against other Empires from real history using Generals, Soldiers, Ideals, Strategies, Tactics and Resources from their own unique Empire.

The object of Empires and Generals is to become the greatest and most powerful Empire. You can do this by gaining Cultural Health or by causing others to lose theirs.

To date the "Family Edition" is free to print and that includes:

The Huns
Roman Republic
Egyptian Kingdom
Ancient China

The Expanded Edition includes:

Ancient Greece 
Achaemenid Persia
and more

And other expansions include:

Act of God Thematic Expansion
The Prince Thematic Expansion
The Great Plague

Using Playing Cards and Resource Cards you build your Empire. Build your Kingdom with Civilization-specific cards. Send your Soldiers out to the Battlefield with the General in the lead. Utilize Strategies and Tactics to suit your personal playing system.

Pick an Empire to represent.

After determining the length of game-play, dominate your opponent by destroying their army or hide behind your walls and win by cunning.

item.description:
Description:
Players control the fate of several regions in the Alpine arc (Rhône-Alpes, Piedmont, the cantons of Uri and Tessin, Tyrol, South Tyrol, Carinthia and Slovenia). Each two of these regions are connected by the Alpine crossings of Mt. Cenis/Fréjus, the Gotthard, the Brenner Pass and Karawanken. At each round, traffic increases. Within ten rounds, regions must try to contain the consequences of traffic by taking actions in the fields of economy, tourism and the environment as well as by implementing measures for transport regulation.

Aim of the game:
The player with the most intact region at the end of round 10 - that is, the player who has obtained the highest scores in Environment, Economy and Tourism and therefore has managed to govern the traffic volume - is the winner.

Course of the game:
The game is played over 10 rounds, in which the following three stages are repeated:
1. Drawing of traffic and event cards and execution of tasks
2. Investment of money
3. Determination of consequences.

Regions can invest only the money they have collected. Players can decide to impact on Tourism, Economy or the Environment and move the corresponding game piece of one field per money invested.
Also, they can play the action cards with traffic regulating measures. The prices for these actions are indicated on the corresponding cards. Some cards can only be played with other regions. 
Other cards affect the traffic in neighboring regions and therefore these players must find the right countermeasures to control this new "unwanted" traffic otherwise the situation get`s out of control and the environment is ruined loosing many points.

item.description:
Squava is a derivative of Yavalath with the same goal but different components. It is intended to be a small simple game.

It is played on a 5x5 square board. 2 players (White and Black) alternate turns placing a pawn of their colour on an empty space of the board.

Players strive to make a line of 4 pieces of their colour, but lose if they make a line of 3 before doing so. Lines can be orthogonal or diagonal.

item.description:
A simple game, rather like Snakes and Ladders but without snakes or ladders.

The board has 100 squares and the object is to be the first to reach square 100.

This must have been a free game sent by post because the board is paper and the teetotum needs to be cut out to act as the die. And you can cut out 'figures' for playing pieces.

Boolean is an abstract strategy game that uses the concepts of Boolean Logic to play. At first created as a learning tool by College Professor Edu Jacober, Boolean was published in 2011 by Ceilikan Jogos. It is now out of print.

Boolean is actually a game system and comes with two distinct sets of rules. The board represent a logic circuit with boolean operations that can be changed by playing cards on the game board.

Basic rules: Players are either black or white (0 or 1) and, by setting the logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: a) buy a card, b)play a card. Circuit inputs are driven by a FIFO line

Advanced rules: Players are also either black or white and, by setting logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: A) buy a card, b) play a card, c) feed a free input with a piece from your score track. Circuit inputs are copied from gameboard latches existent on more valuable locations in the gameboard.

item.description:
Players try to repair holes in their umbrella before rain.
Each umbrella has 5 different colours, player throws a dice, if the dice shows a colour that player doesn't already have he gets to put a counter on that colour, if the dice shows grey a rain cloud is put on the table. When there are five rain clouds, the game ends. Any player who has got five different colours before that wins the game.

item.description: "Can you ride skateboard - Only when I'm sitting in the bus." This fun party question and answer game for any number of children provides 2700 possible combinations of questions and answers.

"A practical set of World War-III wargaming rules for MICRO & HO scale enthusiast [sic]"

Micro armor scale miniature wargame rules for the Superpower's war that (thankfully) never happened.

This is a comprehensive rules set, with rules covering combat engineers, sighting weapons, transport capabilities, airdrops and air assaults, aircraft, morale, and tactical nuclear strikes. It also includes a short (four pages) chapter with orders of battles for American, British, West German, and Soviet units.

Game designed to help children with their maths. A set in this version are a number of cards that form a correct equation. For example; a three card set could be 4 divided by 2 = 2.

A promotional game, by Kellogg's

Not Rummy at all. This game owes more to the British game of Newmarket than it does to Rummy.

The board is interesting, as it opens out to form a cross shape and folds back after play so that it fits into the box.

Players get chips to bet with. They are betting on which card they will play last when they use up all the cards in their hand. The first to do so wins the hand and wins chips from other players, one for each card still in their hands

Indoor golf game. Nine metal 'holes' are included. They are odd shapes so that each hole will play differently, rather like an indoor version of Crazy Golf.

No publisher credited or a date of release. The illustration on the box looks like it is from the 20's or 30's.

The Dual Deck has 96 cards that are similar to Poker cards, except that each card is actually 2 cards combined into 1. There are 2 sets of rank and suit on each card. Players can choose which set they want to use. The Dual Deck puts a new twist on the traditional card games! It is also a cardgame system that is waiting for new games to be designed just for it!

Japanese version of Mahjong for children.
Goal of the game is to collect 3 sets of 4 tiles, and say Punch!
Tiles have pictures of animals.

Later versions Ponjan/Pom Jong (by Anoa, later trademark of Tomy) and Donjara (by Bandai) the goal was to collect 3 sets of 3 tiles. Games have minor differences in how points are counted, but essentially the rules are same. New versions usually have pictures of animation characters, but there are other versions like one with girls from idol group AKB48.

Objective: 
be the first to make correct guesses who has taking over someone's identity (out of players circle)

Each player has to adopt an identity out of participating teammates. Answers should be given out of the perspective of 'transferred' identity. Players must making guesses who is playing whose identity.
 - acting by turn -
1 draw a card
2 let anyone reply to asked question 
3 make a guess which identity is simulated by this player
4 if someone has bet on each teammate game ends
5 each straight tip - given or received - will count

In Search for Gnomes, players attempt to remember as many gnomes as possible in about 15 seconds time. Each round, every player tries to find the right amount of gnomes for each mission played, and after six rounds (in a two-player game) or four rounds (with four players) whoever has the most points wins.

To set up a round, the starting player shuffles the twenty mission tiles face down, then shuffles the 25 forest tiles face up, placing them in a 5x5 grid. Everyone tries to remember as many gnomes and colors as possible, then after 15 seconds, they turn the forest tiles face down. Then each player in turn takes and reveals a mission tile after which a bidding round begins, with players bidding on how well they can complete the mission tiles.

item.description:
Rainbow tiles is a deck that consists of cards each with 4 rectangles of different colours. There are also white lines that resemble roads or paths. The Rainbow Tiles is a game system can be used for tile-laying games.

If you have any suggestions or comments, please join in the discussion at this forum:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/744252/rainbow-tiles-a-tile-gamesystem

Objective: be the first who collected 5 stars answering question cards correctly
 - moving/acting by turn -
luxuriant equipped game 
roll the dice, draw a card, answer question (out of world of dinner & drinks, recipes ..) correctly - multiple choice/possible multiple answers
selection/samples of questions:
what is tartar?
A stone growing on grapes
B small crystalline residues 
C stone needed to press grapes

Cardgame based on popular DKT board game but it's not neither expansion or transformations.

The game uses the fields of Austria-expenditure of DKT as images for the cards and offers three different game ideas: quartet, DKT Schwarzer Peter and DKT land poker. 
There is a play money included for poker variant but in the poker game there are only pairs and triplets of action which very limits the possibilities.

Contents:

 36 cards, 
 play money, 
 1 set of rules

Variation of DKT with a satirical theme. Money is transferred to the Bahamas and Liechtenstein, in the end all Tickets are sold to the state and the rest of the money in the bank - that still exist - all players divided, whoever has the most money wins.

A dexterity game in which players roll a die to select a letter then they must add that letter to the accumulating tower of letters on an unstable platform - without knocking down the tower. If you knock down the tower then you get all the letters that were in the tower. The first person to use all of their letters wins.

There is a journey along a path of hazards and barriers and
players "cooperate" creatively to innovate solutions that let them get home together.

The first path card is laid on the middle of the table and every player plays one tool card from the hand and explains how it could be used to overcome the obstacle on the path card. Then the all players together discuss about the solutions and decide which are the best or how to obsatcle is solved with those tools. If the solution have found all tools are discarded and the next path board is laid out for next round.

There are options for length of play and alternate rules to extend interest in the game. For 2 to 5 players.

Contents:

 25 path cards 
 100 tool cards.

item.description:
Part of the Tiger Klix line.

A portable, magnetic roll-and-move maze game for two players. The object of the game is to escape the graveyard. To do this, you'll have to navigate the graveyard maze and reach the Gravestalker's house in the center of the board. Once there, you may claim the key that will let you escape. But players will also have a chance to move the Gravestalker, in an effort to block their opponent's path. Also watch out for skull spaces on the board, which can send you further away from your goal.

Once you have the key, it's a mad dash to the finish. The first player out wins.

Slasher Movie is a game of Survival Horror, Detection, and Betrayal for 2-6 Players. In Slasher Movie, you play as a character in your very own horror movie. You can play the game trying to save Victims from the various Slashers in your town. Or, you may try to discover who’s responsible for the latest killing. But beware, one of your fellow players may also be a Slasher, ready to strike when you least expect it. What’s more, You may be a Slasher yourself, plotting the demise of everyone else.

From the Publisher's site:

“NEW HOPE CITY, WHERE EVERYONE GETS A SECOND CHANCE.”

In 5150: New Beginnings you're thrust into a bustling, living urban environment hundreds of years in the future. Or maybe it's just a place far, far away. In any case, your goal is to take your characters; we call them Stars, as far as they can go. Acquire wealth, fight crime, commit crime, or something in between; it's all up to you. Want to be an interplanetary smuggler or how about a bounty hunter? Yep, you can be that. Want to feel the rush of jacking up your body with the latest technology and running on the edge. Oh yeah baby, this is the place.

In 5150: New Beginnings you'll find everything you'll need to play an exciting sci-fi adventure game including:

A wide range of Skills, Attributes, Classes and Professions to make each Star unique.
Cyber-Enhancements to give your characters the “edge” they’ll need to compete on the streets of NHC.
Five, truly, Alien Races.
A complete, low maintenance, Campaign System that allows for Character Advancement as well as linking your adventures together.
A realistic Combat System that's easy to learn and adds tension to your games.
Four Basic Encounters that can be played over and over and always with a different result.
And a complete Environment to adventure in, New Hope City.

5150: New Beginnings can be played solo, same side with everyone against the game, or competitively against your friends. It's also playable with any figures you may already have and in any scale. That and it's fully compatible with 5150: Star Army, our military sci-fi game. 5150: New Beginnings is all about the story, your story. So stake out some time, grab a relaxing beverage of your choice and … 
"WELCOME TO 5150: NEW BEGINNINGS WHERE THINGS ARE NOT ALWAYS AS THEY APPEAR."

Players are gangster that must keep their territories safe from others. Move your pawns in New York, trying to reach a secret objectives to win the game.

In your struggle, you will have help of warriors that will fight with punches, kicks and other martial arts skills, but be aware, if you loose a battle, your will loose your warrior and will be an easy target.

objective:
become wine Queen (of king) by collecting appropriate cards
- moving/acting by turn -
moving around the board, solving questions, collecting cards, barrels, increase knowledge about ampelography and - steal what you need from your teammates - to get the crown
doing so you are going to learn - apropos of nothing -
quite a lot about the stuff (ehem.. world of wine) you are dealing with: 
cultivation all over the world, history, different grapes, manufacturing methods, flavours, ..

How can you forge ahead through the jeweled walls of the mine shaft? Shift them! Rotate a game tile a quarter turn to move the mine wall and allow your gemstone access. Or rotate tiles to prevent your opponent from moving. There are walls everywhere, but strategic miners can successfully make their way through to the other side. With 27 game board tiles, the set-ups are unlimited for a brand new game every time you play. 2 players.

item.description:
From their web site:

Tabuals is a deck of 43 cards; 36 of which are considered the core deck with each card depicting a pair of dice of varying combinations. In addition to the core deck, there are 6 additional cards called the Starred Doubles. Although the core deck already contains a pair of each double combintation (double 1's, double 2's, etc.), the Starred Doubles is a second set of doubles denoted by a star to the right of their sum (or rank). This extra set is only used in some of our games to change various game mechanics. Finally, the last card in the deck is the JINX card. This card is also only utilized in some of our games.

There are many types of games that can be played with a deck of Tabuals:
â€¨
Solitaire Gamesâ€¨
Trick-Taking Gamesâ€¨
Casino/Betting Gamesâ€¨
Building Gamesâ€¨
Melding Games

From publisher:

"Svintus 2.0. More animals – more fun!" is a variation of the best-selling Russian card game Svintus. Now there are more cards, more animals, and even more fun.

The object of the game is very simple – you need to get rid of all your cards. However, you can achieve this goal in any number of different ways. Confuse your opponents with Prescriptions, control their every move with Etiquette, break them down with a Challenge to a card duel, or make a fool of them with a Performance card.

The game is completely compatible with the original version, meaning that you can play a classic game of Svintus by removing certain types of cards. The new version introduces 3 new types of cards:

- Etiquette Cards (Snake Behavior) allow you to give cards to those opponents who have behaved a certain way during the game.
- Performance Cards (Show Business Parrot) force your opponent to entertain other players with their talents.
- Challenge Cards (Dog-like Aggression) give you an opportunity to intimidate other players.

The game set concept allows the deck to be tailored using different types of cards to best fit the group of players and their prevailing mood.

Svintus 2.0 is an easy-to-learn, fun-to-play card game with stylish illustrations and topical humor.

Svintus 2.0 is the advanced version of the popular card game Crazy Eights for 2-10 players playable in 15 to 20 minutes.

Object: To be the first player to rid your hand of all cards. Each hand is one round and each game consists of several rounds. The game is over when one player reaches 60 points.[

item.description:
Munchkin Apocalypse is a core set in the Munchkin series with an end of the world theme that includes natural disasters, zombie takeovers, Armageddon, alien invasions, nuclear war, etc. And while this is still a standard Munchkin game where you try to level up by killing the monsters, stealing the treasure, and stabbing your buddy, there's a new "Seal" mechanic that significantly changes the gameplay.

Seals are a reference to the biblical seals of the Apocalypse. They can be opened and closed, although it's typically more difficult to close them. Once seven Seals are open, the game ends immediately, and the player with the highest combat strength (excluding levels) is the winner. The Seal mechanic adds a sense of impending doom to the game, meant to mimic the sense of impending doom for a real apocalypse. It also tends to create situations where the group works together to close a Seal in order to prevent a player from winning via the Seal mechanic. So there is more teamwork than in a regular Munchkin game.

The balance of the deck is also different than the other Munchkin sets. There are a lot more Disaster cards, which are equivalent to traps and curses, so bad things tend to occur more frequently. Also, there are more monsters, especially high-level monsters. To offset this, however, there are more item enhancers and high-bonus items. It's been stated in the Munchkin forums that Munchkin Apocalypse is harder to play and is intended more for seasoned Munchkin veterans.

Munchkin Apocalypse has four new classes but does not have races, powers, or other "thingies". It includes Undead and Shark monsters, which follow special rules.

The game comes with 180 cards (92 Doors, 76 Treasures, 12 Seals). The Seal cards are a different size than the regular cards--they're square and are shorter but wider (2.75" x 2.75"). The included d6 is orange with lime green pips, similar in color to the orange dice in the +6 Bag o' Radioactive Munchkin d6.

- moving by turn -
roll the die, select and move one of your stones, draw cards (if your stone enters scoring positions), reply on questions (if your stone crosses a question mark)
if you give an incorrect answer you have to move your stone into 'left' area, otherwise right (=better) area
you may 'kick' opponent's stones
if a stone reaches 'top level' all stones on lowest level are eliminated
game ends, if all remaining stones are placed on scoring positions

item.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line and became a butterfly 
- moving by turn -
throw 2 dice - the coloured one shows, which caterpillar should be moved, the other die the corresponding number (1-3) of moves. 
But because a caterpillar exists out of 3 parts - head, belly and duff, you must move them sequencing

CALCUL is the 1st boardgame credited to Rudi Hoffmann.

It's like most of his games one with easy to understand and to learn rules but including the special "Kick": Every player starts with two parts of a pyramid cut in half, and following a certain pattern on the gameboard tilting their pieces, they have to reunite these halves to form a complete pyramid on one the the square board fields.
The more players the more challenge, as the space to tilt your pyramid is limited...

The game was a special promotional item for a company doing promotion itself, and it was of immensly high production quality: The game box was a wooden one, the gameboard was printed on top of it and the the pyramid halves were made of wood covered with lacquered cardboard.

Dark forces are moving. Gates are opening all over the city, monsters are on the loose, and Cthulhu is starting to stir from his endless slumber. You need to close all the gates and kill all the monsters before Cthulhu wakes up and destroys everything.

This game is an attempt to make an express version of Arkham Horror. The primary game mechanic is a "Move/Effort" system, in which 2 eight-sided dice are rolled, and one is used for movement and the other for actions. Higher numbers are better for both, but be careful. Every time you roll doubles, you are one step closer to defeat.

The goal of the game is to completely remove the dark forces by closing all the gates and destroying all the monsters. Over the course of the game, various things (the biggest being rolling doubles at any time) cause the doom track to fill up. The players need to remove the dark forces before the track fills, or they all lose.

A beautifully-made variant of n in a row.
Each player gets on the train five animal tiles and try as many of animals place in a row, but in correct environment - the fish in the pond, the bird in the tree, the butterfly on the flower and the hare in the meadow. Star fields are wild areas where each animal may be placed. Who gets rid of the most animals is the winner.

Objective: be the first travelling round the world and win a million Euros
 - moving by turn - 
if you found the correct answer for a question move the number you bet for
if you are positioned on a risc area you even have to move back; positioned on a airfield distance is larger, but you are confrontated with more difficult questions like citations, even a bit 'weird' ones
you may choose the level of difficulty, but all players are challenged to find the correct answer - and may move if ...

item.description:
Promotional game for the Mariahilferstrasse.

Each player has three shopping cards, the player turns around one of his dice in his turn and moves his figure further accordingly. If a figure stops in front of a store, player can take goods chips required for his shopping card. Completed cards should be discarded and new cards are drawn. 
If any player plays the last card, the game ends and who has completed most of purchase cards is the winner.

Title means in English: "We play government!", game was released in 1952.
It was far ahead of its time and with an outstanding equipment.
It was a two-part-game played on both sides of the gameboard:
The first part was a roll-and-move game, but it had many twists to change the later part of the game. 
This second part was played on the backside of the board, on a chess-like pattern, divided in 3 color-coded zones.
Not only that the first part decided which chess-figures you had to play with, no, the figures could be equipped with different heads, depending on which party-side you participated.
Winner was the first party to fill 3 squares at the end of the board.
As you would believe, the color-coded zones played a prominent role in moving and capturing, the rules were really interesting, but an awful lot to learn.
Fascinating stuff from the early German post-war era...

From Wargamedownloads.com


Blasters & Bulkheads utilizes the popular Goalsystem game engine to allow players to run Space Opera skirmish battles in a far-flung future. Build a crew of adventurers and ne'er do wells, or command a kill-squad of Galactic Hegemony enforcers. Rules for combat, campaigns, character advancement and more allow for story-driven campaigns, and four pre-built scenarios allow players to jump right into the action. Written for both 15mm and 28mm miniatures, B&B requires only a handful of figures for each side. Complete character creation rules let players build exactly the type of fighters they want, and rules for the mysterious Essence allow for the existence of strange powers. Prime your blaster, draw your energy sword, and battle for the fate of the galaxy's future!

Money Mania is a stock-speculating boardgame which is completely depending on the luck of 4 different specially designed dice.
The game can be played as a basic game, where each turn a player rolls the two Company Dice and the two Share Dice to see which of the four Companies he may trade in and how many blocks of shares may be traded (each dice is marked 1, 2 or 3). When shares are bought or sold the price goes up or down one unit on the central gameboard for every block of shares traded. As the share price changes players attempt to buy low and sell high in order to make the most profit.

In the advanced game players can expand their possibilities - take out loans and put options. Various random events, such as market trends are also introduced through the use of event cards.

What adds a little fun is the fact, that you can decide what actions you will take with the different results...
Winner is the first player to amass 1.000.000 credits.

This game is only playable with a tiptoi, a 'smart' pencil with an integrated mp3 player, that reacts when you point it on enabled products like this game.

In this game the players have to solve tasks given by the tiptoi, by pointing the tiptoi at the right pictures, letters or words on the game components.

The games designed to help kids get more familiar with letters. Some sample categories of tasks given by the game:
- Find two pictures, beginning with the same letter
- Decide if a given letter is part of a given word
- Construct a word out of a few given letters
- Find a picture with the right rhyme
- ...

The game has 3 difficulty settings, and is a good way to familiarize kids with their letters, who are still struggling with reading. Once their reading skill has reached a decent level, this game will get boring.

Merrills-meets-memory game where players try to eliminate stones of the opponent by getting three of their own pieces in a row. All pieces, though, are hidden, and all of them have the same figure on their backs: initially the orientation shows which figure is which but after a couple of turns players will have moved, swapped and twisted the pieces often enough to confuse anyone without a very reliable memory.

To add insult to injury, some special pieces (Horus falcons) can be uncovered, with fatal consequences for either player (depending on the situation).

Objective: be the first collecting 50 bonus points within 3 categories ==> status, wealth and adventure
 - moving by turn -
roll the dice, move your meeple and follow instructions of the area you land on - that's it - sorry
add on bonus points to 3 different areas - don't forget, that minimum amount of points for status is '21'

inspired by novelist Heinz G. Konsalik

Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible
 - moving by turn - 
simple 'Roll and Move' game
Roll the die, move and perform required actions listed on the area you land on
Optimize the money you start with by decreasing taxes, acquiring assets, increasing status
Most successful (= bonus points) player wins the game

Trivia game with over 500 questions.

This quiz is based on electrical contact - touching the contact surfaces in addition to question and correct answer, the correct answer will light the lamp. Included are 26 tables each with 20 questions, with different topics (many themes from nature, mathematics, history, fairy tales including images).

Similar with Yatzee but there are 5 poker dice instead of regulars.
Each player has three rolls in his turn and choose any choose some dice. After the last roll player decides what poker combination hu uses with his dice.

All excavator drivers try with their equipment to drive around the site, but they have to be careful on the things what is under the earth. A nice run play with a memory factor, certainly most interesting for preschool children, the topic is pretty and the kids can play safely after the declaration alone.

A quiz and trivia game about Europe.
Topics are geography, history, art and culture, entertainment, sports and science-technology-services. Proper answers gives predetermined number of chips or question cards.
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner

item.description:
Objective: collect letters (= bonus points) by forming cards to sentences
 - acting by turn -
each player may place cards (= words) by turn, creating a sentence in a crossword puzzle 'frame'.
If successful player gets a letter corresponding to the letter on (just) placed card. later on these letters can also be used forming words;
end can be determined (time) or if all cards/letters are used
player collected most letters wins

In game Párty you take a role of a guest on a party.

Your goal is to become most favorite person on the Party. Players exchange their sympathy between each other, when are drinking and eating, or dancing. First player, who have sympathy of each color, except his own, wins.

Objective: collect the most toys
 - moving by turn -
player rolls the die and moves according rolled colour
if die shows own colour move twice 
if die shows black don't move
if you land on an aera with a case - open the case and take out a toy
if you land on another player's position take a toy from him/her
if you are the first to pass finish line get all remaining toys out of the cases

Objective: be the first solving 5 quests and become the "Guardian of the Golden Key" 
One of a series of Kosmos games based on the My Secret Unicorn books by Linda Chapman.
In Germany, the series goes by the name, "Sternenschweif" (Star Tail) and the books are also published by Kosmos.
 - acting by turn -
7 (out of 48) cards are given to each player
try to collect matching symbols to solve a quest (totally 5)
if you are successful discard the matching ones and fill up your hand 
some special cards - like Joker - simplify tasks
due to the fact that last round must be completed a tie is possible

In this game you will:

- Bid in the markets, against the other players for those crucial contracts.
- Develop different technologies to produce more valuable robots.
- Upgrade or add to your production, increasing production capacity.
- Make the tricky decision to invest in new offices to exploit new markets around the world.
- Hire Sales Representatives to enter and hopefully win more auctions.
- Make and deliver the goods within the contract deadlines or pay the missed delivery damages.

You will also probably need to take a few loans, but be careful with the hefty interest!

Will you make the most profit or descend into bankruptcy ?


Robofactory is a zero-luck business simulation economic game about manufacturing robots around the world.

The game is modular and based on a large number of different and unique contract cards with different types of order.

The rules come with many different scenarios for players to decide on the length of the game that ranges from introductory games (60 minutes), quick games (90 minutes), normal games (120 minutes) and long games (180 minutes). Players are also encouraged to set up their own scenarios by combining the many contract cards available (please note that playing with ALL available contract cards will turn the game into epic and last a weekend).

item.description: Hexenhaus is a simple dice-driven game for children. One player is the witch, all others are knights. The witch tries to capture the knights, while the knights try to rescue a princess imprisoned in the witch's cottage and bring her back to the castle without being caught by the witch.

Roll and move game, where players collect toys when they stop on a step of their own color. When players get to the last straight they give up all of their toys and move as many steps ahead as they had toys. First to reach goal wins.

item.description:
Traditional Japanese game where a card is revealed from the top of draw pile and players try to find its pair from the cards laid on the table.
Uta-garuta has first three lines of a tanka poem written on the cards in the draw pile and the last two lines on the cards laid on the table, these two cards form a pair. Another version, iroha/garuta, which is mostly played by children for education, has kana written on the other card and a poem or proverb starting with the same kana written on the other card.

Munchkin Conan is a 168-card core set in the Munchkin family of games, with 101 Doors and 67 Treasures. Unlike other core sets, it lacks unique card backs, instead using the standard card back from Munchkin. The included Munchkin-head d6 is yellow with dark red print.

In Munchkin Conan, Robert E. Howard's epic hero gets the full Munchkin treatment. Play a Cimmerian Warrior or a Stygian Wizard! Wield the Sword of the Phoenix and poison your foes with Black Lotus! Slay Thoth-Amon's minions, Pict raiders, and abominable monsters, and hear the lamentations of their women! On many of the cards, the publisher provides context by including relevant quotes from Howard's work.

Munchkin Conan has a new type of card – birthright – and the mechanisms are similar to that of classes and races in that you can have only one in play at a time; you may discard a birthright at any time but may play one only on your turn or when you first get it. The Munchkin Conan core set comes with two birthrights: "Noble", which allows you to have an extra Comrade (see below), and "Barbarian", which allows you to ignore all "Usable By" and "Not Usable By" restrictions on items. There is no birthright analogue to "Super Munchkin" or "Half-Breed".

Speaking of races and classes, the races in Munchkin Conan are "Kushite", "Zamoran", "Cimmerian", and "Stygian"; when playing a blender game, they are all considered to be human unless the other sets have non-human races. The classes are "Cleric", "Thief", "Warrior", and "Wizard", and are identical to the fantasy Munchkin classes with the same names.

The Munchkin Conan hireling is called a Comrade. Comrades fall in the same class as the Hirelings, Minions, Mooks, Sidekicks, etc. that come with other flavors of Munchkin. Each Comrade is associated with a class or birthright, and gives you some of the advantages of that class/birthright. Comrades can carry an item for you, even some that you can't legally use yourself, and their gender matters. They also have the standard Hireling ability to sacrifice themselves to give you an automatic escape when running away.

Part of the Munchkin series.

link.value: Munchkin Get More Loot! Promotional Postcard

item.description:
The Battle of Nations - 14-19 October, 1813

Napoleonic 20 #16 (Germany 20 #7)

What began at the Battle of Dresden and continued to unfold on battlefieds across the German States including Kulm, Dennewitz, Grossbeeren, Gorlitz, and the Katzbach River, have all led up to this. Four Allied nations, and their four armies are converging on Napoleon’s Grande Armée as it falls back to its supply base at Leipzig. More than a half-million soldiers will stand and face eather other over these fateful days, which are now yours to command in this epic installment of VPG's venerable Napoleonic 20 series. The Battle of Nations awaits!

Featuring a strategic scale with corps-sized units and mult-hour game turns, play moves smartly across this, the largest single game map in this series. Helping to tell the narrative of this great battle are new types of Event cards and the inclusion of Strategy cards allowing players to choose their pre-battle disposition and set their overall plan. This tense-and-ever-growing meeting engagement will require skill and strategic sense to master.

Innovations to this game series include the addition of Leader units, whose command span shows the limits of leadership over such a sprawling battlefield. Also, to show the prolonged effects of keeping troops committed to battle, a simple Fatigue system has been added to keep players thinking about reasting their weary forces over the multiple days of the fighting.

Game Data:

Complexity: 5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 4 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is 1 corps, each hex is about 1000 meters, and each turn is roughly 3.5 day hours (or 10 night hours).

Game Components:

• One 8-page, color instructions booklet, with Standard and Optional rules included
• One 6-page sheet of Exclusive rules
• 96 color, die-cut 5/8” mounted game pieces
• 28 color, die-cut 5/8” markers
• 24 Event cards
• One 22” x 17” color game map
• Four color player aid sheets
• Polybag packaging and component storage

In Table Shuffleboard, players push wooden pucks
down a long and smooth(!) wooden table into a scoring area at the opposite end of the table.

Shooting is performed with 'hammer' construction directly, 
After both players (or teams) are finished shooting, then add up the score based on where the pucks finally landed on the Table Shuffleboard. It is not allowed that puck touches side band
scoring: puck scores depending (numbered) area it lands on
variants: quite a lot, like curling (similar to sport game)

A memory-matching card game used to teach children about fire, fire hazards and fire safety. The 30 cards are laid out face down and players turn cards over to make matches. When a correct pair is found, it is removed from the board and the player scores a point. If a match card or lighter card is turned over, it is removed from the game along with the other overturned card. The player with the most points wins.

Based on the popular game Crazy Eights, this lively card game delivers fast-paced fun while helping kids become aware of their unique and special qualities. Players draw, match, and shed cards, answering questions as they go. (For example: "Would you choose yourself as a friend? Why or why not?")

Because only half of the cards include questions, the game moves along at a brisk pace. Special cards--Switch Direction, Leap, and Wild Cards--introduce an element of surprise. Players race to get rid of their cards and be first to proclaim "One of a Kind." For added excitement, the rules provide a way for quick-thinking players to jump in at the last minute and keep the game alive.

After each round of play, smiles abound--because kids are not only having fun but also feeling better about themselves.

Image search under time pressure! For each question there is to find the called number of matching images. For example, "Find 4 pictures with something that has eyes" or "Find two images with a fish." Who is in it, gets all the playing pieces, and it will read a question. Then the timer is started, and the player tries to find as quickly as possible, the popular image maps. Accompanying photos are marked with a character. If all images have found, the timer stops. The remaining time is the points standings for the block. After four rounds the player with the most points wins.

name.value: Donald Duck's Party Game for Young Folks

item.description:
Donald Duck's Party Game for Young Folks is a "spin" and move game for young children.

The object of the game is to collect three prize tokens. The first player to do this is the winner.

The prizes are collected by moving the player pawns (four versions of Donald Duck) around the board by spinning a movement spinner until one player has landed on three "prize" spaces. The spinner is divided in to 4 quadrants numbered 1 to 4 with each one containing one square for each colored pawn that will determine the color of pawn to be moved and the number of spaces to move. While moving the player must read aloud what is written on the spaces as they pass them and perform any action that is in the space. For example "Stand up and take a bow" Once a player has landed on three prize spaces they are the winner. The winner must then do what the three prize tokens say.

Felix travels through Germany to visit many sights. Player plays a destination card and a kilometer card, shows his destination and its picture on the board and if the distance is lower than the kilometers you played, you set the card aside for a victory point. If there are other destinations en route, you can set them aside as well. Another player who has cards for destinations on that route can set them aside, too. When Felix is back in Münster and one player has played all his cards, the player with most cards wins.

Flocki and his doggy friends play at retrieving socks. Each player chooses a dog disc, the sock tiles are briefly displayed openly and then turned over. The active player rolls the die, this is the sock the dogs should retrieve. All players now look for this sock and place their dog disc as fast as the can onto the tile they think is the correct one. More than one disc is allowed on a tile, they are stacked. When all have placed their dog the tiles are turned over: If you did find the correct sock, you score chip points: 3 if you were the fastest, 2 if you were second and all others score 1 point. If you selected a wrong sock, you lose points. Then you switch 2 sock tiles. When all chips have been given out, you win with most points from your chips.

Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible finding correct answers 
 - geographic quiz, split into 3 phases, acting by turn -
phase 1 
each player draws (randomly) a country card, memorizes data (as much as possible), localisates country and asks / answers questions
phase 2
each player rolls the die finding answers to selected questions regarding 'his country'
phase 3
each player determines by die a question card (world history) and faces the neighbour with a true/untrue questions

Seiji Kanai created the two-player abstract game RR – Regality and Religion – for a design competition with this restriction: "Create a game for 500 yen" (about $5). The game consists of 15 cards.

Both players start with a set of seven identical cards that act as pawns on a 3x3 board. Players take turns placing one of their cards in hand onto the board, with the card facing the active player. Some cards, when placed, rotate one or more of the surrounding cards upside down, making them face the other way; other cards destroy surrounding cards.

The game ends when the board is full, at which point the player with the most cards facing him wins.

Re-implemented by:

 RRR – Regality vs. Religion: Revolution, an enhanced version of RR, comes in a box with a game board, card board tiles instead of cards, and eleven "neutral" tiles, five of which are randomly used in each game and available to both players.

item.description:
MAPOMINOES is the game that takes you to the edge of the world!

This portable game is fun, easy to learn, educational and highly addictive and makes a great present for any family member interested in geography or travel.

It’s like dominoes but with maps, as you build a map of the Americas, by connecting countries that share a common border. Stay one step ahead of your opponents, as you race to be the first player to play all your country cards on the table and win the game. Block your opponents by holding on to Mexico or Colombia or open up South America by playing Brazil. Take a boat through the Caribbean Sea to Cuba or transit by train through the USA to Canada. Try not to get stuck with Suriname, or miss a boat to the Bahamas as you watch the country cards spread across the table. The excitement builds as you have fewer and fewer cards left to play, but less space to play them in as you reach the edge of the world. (The table’s edge). Every country card is different due to their varying border connections and hence no two games are ever the same in this clever game that you will want to play again and again. Play as a stand alone game or combine with Mapominoes games for other continents to make to expand the game to cover the world. A simple game with hidden strategic depth that gives it broad appeal to both children and adults.

Objective: collect as many flowers as possible
 - acting by turn -
roll the coloured die, choose one of those bees which where place previously onto flowers of the board,
if the flower shows the same colour take it and put the bee on another flower

In the far future, humanoid empires of the universe turned to an intense study of ancient civilizations that existed on a planet known as Earth. They learned that these ancients simultaneously built pyramids towards the sky and had an extensive knowledge of the stars. It was rumored that perhaps they were the original colonizers and space-farers of the first human age.

Now, at the edge of a colossal black hole, a pyramid-craft known as the Zoneplex has emerged with legendary markings and glyphs of the deep past. The known empires have sent their elite warrior-monk mystics on a one-way mission to gain control of the Zoneplex, to emerge victorious and ultimately control the pathways of the universe and time itself.

Zoneplex is a game that combines a tile-laying/exploration mechanism, a collaborative battle system and a zone control system to create an intriguing adventure in an alien pyramid.

The game works in 2 phases with the first phase players not counting Influence points until the pyramid is completed.

In phase 1 players strategically lay tiles determined by action cards to build their pathway through the Zoneplex pyramid whilst being cognizant of the Sacred Symbol card that they are bestowed with before the game begins. While building strategically players also confront creatures within the pyramid which they must collect to become worthy to enter the Eye and win the game. The players control the Zoneplex by gaining Influence points which occurs when a Player places a spirit-stone on the board. Spirit Stones not only sustain one's Influence points but can also be removed to gain bonuses in combat.

In phase 2 after exploring the pyramid, the players reveal their Sacred Symbol cards and count influence points, then a cutthroat race for survival and worthiness begins as players vie to enter "The Eye of The Zoneplex" to become the decisive winner or stand their ground with the most influence points as the action cards run out.

Objective:
get a job, acquire 50.000 € and own 3 friendship cards
 - moving by turn -
you start as an emigrant, trying to get all neccessary tools like visa, job, vaccination, change of residence ...
moving around you must follow instructions on cards to be drawn
if you've finished 'preliminaries' you are allowed to fly to chosen country (change from outer to inner circle)

Now you have to make money, friends ...

Objective: be the first to get rid of all your chips
- acting simultaniously -
three dice with symbols . colour, circles and figures - are thrown
combine all of them and find correspondend picture on one of the boards
being the first you get rid of one of your chips to be placed upon that picture

Objective: be the first to move each of your three tiles across finish line (centre of the board)
 - acting/moving by turn -
roll the die and move - depending on area you land on you must draw a correspondent card (different topics)
if answer is correct move your tile one step into directon of the middle of the board (inner circles)
if you step on already occupied area opponent's tile is going to be moved back to start position if you win the fight (faster reply on question); the winning tile moves on into direction of the middle of the board

The frogs sing a lullaby to the princess. Some frogs, however, want to catch flies rather than singing and that's what you have to smuggle themselves into the choir and catch the other players in this smuggling. Each player place a card face down on the bed and says a spell or he doubts that all the frogs sing out really, who has cheated or who doubted wrongly loses a frog.
Player who has the biggest frog choir at the end of the game is the winner.

Every card has three questions about football in categories like players, clubs and matches on its frontside and answers on the backside. The Reader reads the questions and player who answers correctly first gets the card. If nobody answers correctly the card goes out of play. If all cards have played out, the player with the most cards is the winner

Contetns:
55 cards

It was only supposed to be a onetime deal to make a little extra cash. That was several years, countless deals, and a few arrests ago. Now you can't even imagine a life doing anything else. The money is too good to give it up. At least it was until someone started moving in on your territory.

Druggies is a flip toss game where each player takes the role of a drug dealer trying to get and sell drugs in an effort to be the first seller to reach the sales goal.

WHAT IS A FLIP TOSS GAME?

A flip toss game is a boardgame that uses a coin of some sort, instead of dice or cards, to determine different results during the course of the game. This is achieved by flipping a coin and trying to get it to land in a desired location on the game board.

The top card of the deck is turned over, the player guesses on his turn, whether the animal is larger or smaller on the next card. There are a total of nine delightfully drawn animals: mouse, dog, monkey, sheep, tiger, bear, horse, elephant and giraffe, and therefore is in the appearance of giraffe or the mouse does not rate very difficult, but with monkey, tiger and sheep it is not so easy to estimate. For correct answers you get small chips. 5 small chips are worth 1 large chips. Player with the 5 large chips wins the game.

item.description:
Hero Express is a superhero re-theme of Arkham Express by David Willems.

Players will select one of the six included Heroes, or make your own, each with a unique special ability.

During a player's turn they will roll 5 Hero dice with unique symbols on each side, after rolling they have the option of re-rolling 3 more times.

If the "Villain" symbol is rolled on a die it is locked and cannot be re-rolled (unless the hero has an ability that allows it).

If 3 Villain symbols appear a new crime is reported and a new villain appears in Dark City.

The other sides of the dice include movement, Hero tokens (spent to use superpowers and items), recovery, and combat symbols (used when fighting the villains).

Capturing Villains allow the gathering of Justice Points, which are spent at a super secret location to purchase new abilities and items.

If at anytime there is 9 active crimes on the board, they Mayor will replace your team.

Each player must carefully choose how to use their abilities, items and hero tokens to thwart crimes and ultimately draw the Crimelord from hiding and defeat him.

Again I would like to thank David Willems for allowing me to create this re-theme, and for creating Arkham Express.

Objective: collect as many bonus points (chips) as possible
 - acting by turn -
place on any flower and stalk a red chip ( 1 bonus point)
place on any butterfly a green chip (2 bonus points)
roll the dice
phase 1 
start on stalks ==> if your dice show matching numbers - take a red chip - if the chip was already taken off: bad luck
rolling a '2' or '5' double ==> take a butterfly - from the board or from another player
phase 2
if all red chips placed on stalks are reaped start with chips on flowers - same procedure as described above
game ends if all chips are harvested

1 board, 4 butterflies, 20 red chips, 4 green chips, 2 dice, 
1 rule sheet

get rid of your cards (places to visit) and reach Bredstedt at the end

simple 'Roll and Move' game 
choose the best route to discard your cards 
if you land on a 'chance' field follow instructions
if you land on a place you possess a card of ==> answer a question drawn by another player - if you succeed, discard it
if not - discard the previous card but draw a new, additional card;
in this way you learn more about 'Frisia', a northern part of Germany 
rules, cards and map are printed in German and Friesian

Objective: get on your (male) feet, find a proper lady and be the first taking her home (doesn't matter if it is her or your home)
- moving by turn - 'Roll and Move'
4 ladies are waiting to be caught (sorry: married) but board and rules are made to create a bit confusion and trouble
the way to find a lady can be easy - roll and move but
taking her home (depending on colours) is difficult because 
appropriate cards must be drawn & instructions followed;
opponents are waiting to pinch your lady - much easier than
choosing detours - or to change ladies, if the their way home seems be faster/shorter

name.value: Der Eismann Ötzis Reise durch die Zeit

item.description:
Objective: become the wealthiest stone age man 
 - acting/moving by turn -

Phase 1: 
Collect as many property cards as possible ==> 

 don't marry too often - you must feed them all 
 avoid wolves and bears
 make reasonable deals on stone age markets
 find correct answers for drawn questions cards
 try to get copper - the most precious good
 make well elaborated moves




if you think that you prepared yourself well ==>
Phase 2

 be the first crossing the glacier (surviving!)
 getting a big bonus - all property is going to be calculated ==> 




Resulting in winning the game

This is a set of rules designed for use with 6mm or 2mm strips of figures, though other figure scales could be used if desired. Two different basing systems are suggested: 1) where units are comprised of multiple strips with strips being removed when casualties are taken, or 2) units are made of 1 or 2 strips, with unit strength tracked with a roster or with casualty markers.

Units are defined in terms of battlefield purpose (battle unit, auxiliary, skirmish, and other), and unit grade (elite, veteran, average, and raw).
